statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} -8 \\ -7 \\ -8 \\ 7 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 2 \\ 2 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ -1 \\ -1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ 0 \\ 1 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 3 \\ 1 \\ 1 \\ -1 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} -8 \\ -7 \\ -8 \\ 7 \end{array}\right] is a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 2 \\ 2 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ -1 \\ -1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ 0 \\ 1 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 3 \\ 1 \\ 1 \\ -1 \end{array}\right].
